intro: Schiedea obovata, commonly known as the Oahu silver bush, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to a dense covering of fine hairs. The plant typically grows as a shrub with upright stems and produces small, white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and montane habitats. Schiedea obovata is an endemic species, highlighting the unique botanical diversity of Hawaii.
